page.title: 08Police Station:Chatteris
page.content: The present station was built in 1975. There are 5 P.C.s and one sergeant. They cover from Mepal Pits to Mill Hill roundabout and Manea Washes to Benwick. They open from{9.00 {to 5.00}and after this the area is patrolled by a police car which is an Escort 1100. There are no police dogs. Chatteris has a{low crime rate.}The most common offence is{vandalism}or if the damage exceeds Â£20, criminal damage. Such crimes are most common in the school holidays. There are not many{burglaries.}Most are on industrial premises and farms. There is at least one{drunken driver}per week. There isn't much glue sniffing but{drugs}are a problem. For 999 calls it is quicker to phone March. Average response time for Chatteris is 17 minutes. Many of these calls are unnecessary and waste time.
